definition: either of two folds of skin that can be moved to cover or open the eye
opposite_reasoning: Eyelid lacks a true antonym as it's a specific anatomical structure. InternalOrgan provides the strongest coherent anatomical opposition: external↔internal, protective surface↔metabolic depth, appendage↔core system. This maintains semantic relevance within biological/medical domains while providing clear distributional separation. While AI safety utility is limited (this is an anatomical concept, not behavioral/moral), InternalOrgan offers the most defensible Fisher-LDA axis for distinguishing external protective structures from internal functional organs.
